rules: Rule1: If the organization funds research, then the government mitigates impact.
Rule2: Either the satellite observes a phenomenon or the sensor detects an anomaly.

Rule3: Whenever the sensor detects an anomaly, then under the condition that it is not the case that the platform promoting consensus implies the platform does not accept data, the public influences policy.

Rule4: If the team calibrates an instrument, then if the satellite observes a phenomenon, then given that it is not the case that the platform promoting consensus implies the platform does not accept data, the public influences policy.
Rule5: The team calibrates an instrument or the team analyzes data.

Rule6: Should the lab replicate an experiment, then if it is not the case that if the team analyzes data then (if the satellite observes a phenomenon then (if it is not the case that the platform promoting consensus implies the platform does not accept data then the public influences policy)), the journal retracts a paper.
Rule7: The lab replicates an experiment or the panel reviews methodology.

Rule8: Whenever the panel reviews methodology, then if it is not the case that if the team analyzes data then (if the satellite observes a phenomenon then (if it is not the case that the platform promoting consensus implies the platform does not accept data then the public influences policy)), the journal retracts a paper.
Rule9: Either the organization denies climate change or the organization funds research.
Rule10: Provided that the platform censors a study, the platform does not accept data.
Rule11: The platform censors a study or the platform promotes consensus.
Rule12: If it is not the case that if the organization publishes a report then the organization does not deny climate change, then the platform accepts data.
Rule13: If it is not the case that either the researcher verifies a model or the platform does not accept data, then the agency confirms a hypothesis.
Rule14: Should it not be the case that either the researcher verifies a model or the platform does not accept data, then the scientist disputes findings.
Rule15: In case it is not the case that either the researcher verifies a model or the platform does not accept data, it is not the case that the scientist disputes findings.

Rule16: Should it not be the case that if it is not the case that either the researcher verifies a model or the platform does not accept data then it is not the case that the agency confirms a hypothesis, then the institute awards a grant.

Rule17: Whenever it is not the case that if it is not the case that either the researcher verifies a model or the platform does not accept data then it is not the case that the agency confirms a hypothesis, it is not the case that the institute awards a grant.
facts: Fact1: The organization publishes a report.
Fact2: It is not the case that the journal retracts a paper.
Fact3: It is not the case that the researcher verifies a model.
Fact4: The public does not influence policy.
